title: Oil Rises After OPEC+ Extends Cuts
text: Oil prices are rising, with Brent topping $43 a barrel. This comes after OPEC and its allies agreed to extend production cuts by an extra month. Bloomberg’s Stephen Stapczynski reports on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: World shares advance on surprise U.S. job recovery
text: U.S. stock futures and Asian shares advanced on Monday after a surprise recovery in U.S. employment gave further confidence of a quick economic recovery after many weeks of lockdowns aimed at controlling the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Dow futures rise 160 points Sunday evening as stock market looks to extend rally headed into Fed week
text: U.S. stock-market futures rose solidly Sunday evening in thin trading, as Wall Street equities appeared set to add to a rally to near records for the Nasdaq that concluded trade last week on the back of improving economic data in the face of a viral outbreak.

title: Dow futures rise 100 points as Wall Street tries to add to last week's rally
text: U.S. stock futures rose slightly on Sunday night following last week's sharp gains amid optimism over the economy reopening.

title: The Recent Market Performance Is Not Surprising After All
text: Stock markets are supposed to follow corporate earnings, or so the saying goes. Therefore, it’s natural for stock prices to climb to new highs when companies report stellar growth in profits.

title: The recovery is underway. Does that mean it's time for more stimulus?
text: Record stimulus efforts are facilitating the global recovery from the steepest economic downturn since the Great Depression. That means it's time to spend even more, investors and economists say.

title: The Fed deserves the praise for America’s jobs turnaround. But Trump benefits
